getting-started_key3: We welcome you aboard to teach **Basics of `Python` Programming, Spoken English and Touch Typing** to over **100k young women** between the age group of 15-25, from various parts of the country. Your contribution is highly valuable in creating a drastic impact in the learning journey of these young women and enabling them to get an **aspirational job**, have **a voice**, and be equipped to **bring at least 10 families out of poverty** in a financially sustainable model.
getting-started_key4: We're glad you have decided to teach young children remotely and contribute in bringing a difference in their lives.
getting-started_key5: To ensure you have a smooth onboarding and enable you to self start this process, sharing a few simple steps you can follow.
getting-started_key7: We have a student facing Android
getting-started_key8: and a website that caters to volunteers, partners, clients, etc. Please download the
getting-started_key10: and sign in. Spend some time and explore the
getting-started_key12: *(Our students use an android phone to access Meraki, hence we request you to go over the `application` and understand the user interface. This can help you connect with students and solve their questions easily.)*
getting-started_key13: You can see the following videos for further assistance
getting-started_key14: Signing into Meraki and Home Screen
getting-started_key16: > You'll be using the [website](https://www.merakilearn.org, "Meraki") more often than the android `application`, to schedule your classes, etc. We ask you to use the Android `Application` to understand the interface from the student's perspective.
getting-started_key17: For the next steps, Sign into
getting-started_key23: > *You may follow the respective links and fret not if you get stuck! You can write to us at volunteer@navgurukul.org in case of queries. We are here to help!*
